channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping behind Longmeadow Road Footpath 154, 17th June
item.description:
Someone has dumped building rubble blocking footpath 154. This has been there for about a month.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 193, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised metal frame around manhole cover, 17th June
item.description:
The metal frame around the manhole cover is protruding above the road surface. Both the paving stones inside the cover and the surrounding road surface are deformed and uneven. This creates a serious hazard for pedestrians, cyclists, children, and vehicles — it could cause trips, falls, or damage to tyres. The issue is located in the middle of the road and requires urgent repair to ensure public safety.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign facing wrong direction, 17th June
item.description:
After years of requesting a no through road sign 11am-11pm Bedfordbury to New Row, one has been put up, but it is the wrong way round! It is facing up Bedfordbury, rather than as you turn into it from Chandos Place. In other words you would drive up Bedfordbury, find it blocked, turn around and see the sign on exiting Bedfordbury

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brydges Place, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
